segment.source: Creating a New Filter Driver
segment.target: Creating a New Filter Driver

segment.source: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new filter driver.
segment.target: In this topic we explain how to use Visual Studio to start writing a new filter driver.

segment.source: Filter drivers are different from device function drivers, software drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.
segment.target: Filter drivers are different from device function drivers, software drivers, and file system drivers, which we cover in other topics.

segment.source: To learn about filter drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see the following topics.
segment.target: To learn about filter drivers and how they differ from other types of drivers, see the following topics.

segment.source: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your filter driver.
segment.target: To begin, first determine which driver model is appropriate for your filter driver.

segment.source: For help determining which model is best for you, see Choosing a Driver Model.
segment.target: For help determining which model is best for you, see Choosing a Driver Model.

segment.source: If you are writing a filter driver for a hardware device, determine where your device fits in the list of technologies described in Device and Driver Technologies.
segment.target: If you are writing a filter driver for a hardware device, determine where your device fits in the list of technologies described in Device and Driver Technologies.

segment.source: See the documentation for that particular technology to see whether there is any guidance for choosing a filter driver model.
segment.target: See the documentation for that particular technology to see whether there is any guidance for choosing a filter driver model.

segment.source: The recommended filter driver model varies from one technology to the next.
segment.target: The recommended filter driver model varies from one technology to the next.

segment.source: For some technologies, the documentation recommends using the User Mode Driver Framework (UMDF), the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), or the Windows Driver Model (WDM).
segment.target: For some technologies, the documentation recommends using the User Mode Driver Framework (UMDF), the Kernel Mode Driver Framework (KMDF), or the Windows Driver Model (WDM).

segment.source: For other technologies, the documentation gives explicit details on how to write a filter driver.
segment.target: For other technologies, the documentation gives explicit details on how to write a filter driver.

segment.source: Some technologies have mini filter models.
segment.target: Some technologies have mini filter models.

segment.source: For some technologies, there might not be any recommendation for a filter driver model.
segment.target: For some technologies, there might not be any recommendation for a filter driver model.

segment.source: Next, determine which of the following cases describes your driver model recommendation and follow the steps:
segment.target: Next, determine which of the following cases describes your driver model recommendation and follow the steps:

segment.source: Case 1: The documentation for your technology recommends UMDF.
segment.target: Case 1: The documentation for your technology recommends UMDF.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select Visual C++ | Windows Driver | WDF.
segment.target: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select Visual C++ | Windows Driver | WDF.

segment.source: In the middle pane, select User Mode Driver (UMDF).
segment.target: In the middle pane, select User Mode Driver (UMDF).

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: For more information, see Writing a UMDF Driver Based on a Template.
segment.target: For more information, see Writing a UMDF Driver Based on a Template.

segment.source: Note When you create a new UMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.
segment.target: Note When you create a new UMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.

segment.source: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.
segment.target: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.

segment.source: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most UMDF drivers.
segment.target: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most UMDF drivers.

segment.source: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.
segment.target: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.

segment.source: Case 2: The documentation for your technology recommends KMDF.
segment.target: Case 2: The documentation for your technology recommends KMDF.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select WDF.
segment.target: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select WDF.

segment.source: In the middle pane, select Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF).
segment.target: In the middle pane, select Kernel Mode Driver (KMDF).

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: For more information, see Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template.
segment.target: For more information, see Writing a KMDF Driver Based on a Template.

segment.source: Note When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.
segment.target: Note When you create a new KMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.

segment.source: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.
segment.target: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.

segment.source: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.
segment.target: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by most KMDF drivers.

segment.source: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.
segment.target: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.

segment.source: Case 3: The documentation for your technology describes a specific filter or mini filter model.
segment.target: Case 3: The documentation for your technology describes a specific filter or mini filter model.

segment.source: If your device technology has a specific filter or minifilter model, check to see if Visual Studio has a template for the model.
segment.target: If your device technology has a specific filter or minifilter model, check to see if Visual Studio has a template for the model.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select Templates | Visual C++ | Windows Driver.
segment.target: In the New Project dialog box, in the left pane, locate and select Templates | Visual C++ | Windows Driver.

segment.source: Browse the list of installed templates to see whether there is a template for the type of filter you need to write.
segment.target: Browse the list of installed templates to see whether there is a template for the type of filter you need to write.

segment.source: For example, you might choose the Filter Driver: NDIS template under Networking.
segment.target: For example, you might choose the Filter Driver: NDIS template under Networking.

segment.source: If there is no template for your type of filter driver under Windows Driver, click Online and browse the templates that are available online.
segment.target: If there is no template for your type of filter driver under Windows Driver, click Online and browse the templates that are available online.

segment.source: If you find a template for your type of filter driver, select the template, fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: If you find a template for your type of filter driver, select the template, fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by your filter driver.
segment.target: At this point, you have a driver project that implements the general code required by your filter driver.

segment.source: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.
segment.target: Now you can supply the code that is specific to your filter.

segment.source: Refer to the documentation for your technology to learn about the functions that you need to implement.
segment.target: Refer to the documentation for your technology to learn about the functions that you need to implement.

segment.source: If your device technology has a specific filter model or a minifilter model, and you can't find a template for your type of filter driver, refer to your technology-specific documentation for guidance to determine whether to use UMDF, KMDF, or WDM.
segment.target: If your device technology has a specific filter model or a minifilter model, and you can't find a template for your type of filter driver, refer to your technology-specific documentation for guidance to determine whether to use UMDF, KMDF, or WDM.

segment.source: Case 4: The documentation for your technology recommends WDM.
segment.target: Case 4: The documentation for your technology recommends WDM.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select WDM.

segment.source: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.
segment.target: Fill in the Name and Location boxes, and click OK.

segment.source: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.
segment.target: At this point, you have an empty WDM driver project.

segment.source: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.
segment.target: In the Solution Explorer window, right-click your driver project, and choose Add | New Item.

segment.source: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Add New Item dialog box, select C++ File (.cpp), enter a name for your file, and click OK.

segment.source: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.
segment.target: Note If you want to create a .c file instead of a .cpp file, enter a name that has the .c extension.

segment.source: Implement the functions required by your filter.
segment.target: Implement the functions required by your filter.

segment.source: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add additional .cpp or .c files.
segment.target: As you implement and organize your functions, you might decide to add additional .cpp or .c files.

segment.source: Case 5: The documentation for your technology does not have a recommendation for a filter driver model.
segment.target: Case 5: The documentation for your technology does not have a recommendation for a filter driver model.

segment.source: Determine whether UMDF, KMDF, or WDM is the best model for your filter driver.
segment.target: Determine whether UMDF, KMDF, or WDM is the best model for your filter driver.

segment.source: For help, see Choosing a Driver Model.
segment.target: For help, see Choosing a Driver Model.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, on the File menu, choose New | Project.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select one of the following templates:
segment.target: In Visual Studio, in the New Project dialog box, under Windows Driver, select one of the following templates:

segment.source: Note When you create a new KMDF or UMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.
segment.target: Note When you create a new KMDF or UMDF driver, you must select a driver name that has 32 characters or less.

segment.source: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.
segment.target: This length limit is defined in wdfglobals.h.

segment.source: Implement the functions required by your filter.
segment.target: Implement the functions required by your filter.

segment.source: Create new .c or .cpp files as needed.
segment.target: Create new .c or .cpp files as needed.

segment.source: If you are not sure which template to use, consider reading or posting to the Windows Hardware WDK and Driver Development forum.
segment.target: If you are not sure which template to use, consider reading or posting to the Windows Hardware WDK and Driver Development forum.
